central_thesis: The core thesis revolves around the Setian's path of magical evolution, termed 'Setamorphosis,' which is achieved through an alchemical process of self-refinement and the attunement to, and integration with, specific magical entities or 'names' that serve as catalysts and guides for personal transformation and the actualization of one's higher self.

structure_content.summary: This article discusses the Anubis Pylon's experience with perceiving magical names or entities. It posits that these entities are not chosen but rather emerge as a reflection of the Setian's evolutionary needs, acting as 'short-cuts' for development. The authors question whether these entities are telesmic images or existing beings, leaning towards the latter, and emphasize their role in attuning the Setian towards 'Setamorphosis' by embodying desired qualities. The entities are seen as evolving, potentially becoming obsolete as the Setian progresses, leading to new cycles of development.

Ricco A. Zappitelli defines Setamorphosis as a magical evolution involving 'Xeper to a different entity or form.' He applies alchemical principles to this process, identifying the Setian's body and mind as the 'crucible' or 'thurible.' The 'base elements' to be refined are food, air, and sensory impressions. Practical steps include deep breathing, a vegetarian diet, and careful selection of mental input to generate an 'electric spark' that initiates the alchemical transformation towards an 'awakened state' and Setamorphosis.

This is a poetic and philosophical piece reflecting on the Setian's relationship with Set. The author emphasizes transcending temporal limitations ('the past is dead... the future is yet to be') and embracing the 'ever-present now' through the will of the magician. It speaks of finding inner strength, hope, and balance amidst external negativity, leading to a state of 'intoxication' from the beauty of existence. The 'Gift of your love' from Set is presented as the means to immortality through true magic.

structure_content.chapter_title: [4] Open Letter to the Temple of Set
structure_content.summary: Joan Keller's personal reflection on her 70th birthday contrasts the rigid social and spiritual norms of her childhood with the 'Electronic (Magic) Age.' She expresses a sense of belonging and optimism for the future, viewing the 'age of the Setians' as a time for strong, responsible individuals capable of independent thought, whom she believes will 'inherit the Earth.'

key_concepts.definition: Pre-existing beings or archetypal forces that manifest to a Setian, not chosen by the individual, but perceived as aligned with their current evolutionary needs. They embody qualities the Setian aspires to and serve as 'short-cuts' for development, evolving or being replaced as the Setian progresses towards Setamorphosis. Magister Barrett describes them as 'you ahead of yourself'.

A transformative process for Setians, defined as 'a changing in form... through magical evolution, involving Xeper to a different entity or form than what we presently know ourselves to be.' It represents the ongoing alchemical refinement of the self towards a higher state of being within the Setian philosophy.

The application of traditional alchemical principles to the Setian's personal evolution. The Setian themselves become the 'crucible' or 'thurible' in which 'base elements' – namely food, air, and sensory impressions – are consciously refined and transmuted by will and magical effort to achieve Setamorphosis. This process aims to condense and purify the 'mundane, human, coarse elements' into essence.

Mentioned as a key component of Setamorphosis, specifically 'involving Xeper to a different entity or form.' While the text does not provide an explicit definition, its usage implies a process of self-creation, becoming, or transformation into something new and distinct from one's prior state.

Images created by the mind, or the essence of pre-existing beings. The authors of 'By Any Other Name' ponder if their magical entities are merely manifestations of imagination (telesmic images) or actual existing beings, ultimately leaning towards the latter but acknowledging the former as a possibility for ancient Egyptian creations.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is one of internal, alchemical self-transformation (Setamorphosis) facilitated by conscious interaction with magical entities. It posits the Setian as both the subject and object of this alchemical work, refining their physical and mental 'base elements' to achieve higher states of being. The system emphasizes self-awareness, discipline in controlling external inputs (impressions), and the cultivation of internal energy through specific practices to fuel the 'spark' of magical evolution.
tools: The Setian's own body and mind (as 'crucible'/'thurible')
Will (for directing inner alchemy and overcoming negative influences)
Deep breathing exercises and meditation (to oxygenate the brain and achieve awakened states)
Conscious selection of sensory impressions (to exclude 'wrong and negative' input)
Dietary choices (e.g., vegetarian diet for increased oxygen supply)
rituals: New Year's Eve feast and ritual (Anubis Pylon)
General ritual experiences (as catalysts for evolution and perceiving entities)
Attunement rituals (implied, for connecting with magical entities)

relevant_quotes.text: The name was held to be a definition of the essential nature of the individual and the plan of his development. That is why one person could receive several names according to the stages of his evolution.
Magister Barrett has described the magical entity acquired by the Setian as 'you ahead of yourself'.
Setamorphosis: A changing in form by Setians through magical evolution, involving Xeper to a different entity or form than what we presently know ourselves to be.
The Setian has three kinds of ingredients or base elements with which to work. These three materials are: (1) the food he consumes; (2) the air he breathes; and (3) the impressions he takes in.

The more effort made, the more this energy increases with application. With the non-application of this energy, the energies rush out. With food as bulk material and oxygen to boost the brain, all that is needed is the right input added to awakening and we begin.

critical_analysis.relevance: These articles are highly relevant for understanding the early development of practical Setian philosophy within the Temple of Set. They provide insight into the experiential and evolving nature of Setian magic, particularly concerning personal transformation (Setamorphosis) and the interaction with magical entities/names. The alchemical framework offers a structured approach to self-development, bridging ancient traditions with modern occult practice. The personal accounts ground the esoteric concepts in tangible experience, making them accessible to practitioners grappling with similar evolutionary paths.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is Setian initiates and those deeply involved in Western Esotericism and occult practices, particularly within the Temple of Set or related Left-Hand Path traditions. Individuals interested in practical self-transformation, magical evolution, and the nature of magical identity would find these texts valuable. The technical language and philosophical depth suggest a readership already familiar with esoteric concepts.
